author: Staff Reporter
text:
The two-week long events in connection with the World Leprosy Eradication Day under the aegis of the National Leprosy Eradication Programme culminated with rally here on Tuesday. The programme was organised to commemorate the Day on the last Sunday of January. The event witnessed students carrying placards bearing slogans breaking the stigma associated with leprosy. Students from across schools and colleges participated in the rally taking forward messages breaking misconceptions concerning the disease. Slogans bearing information such as leprosy is not a hereditary disease was prominent all through the rally.

Benefits

Welfare benefits for persons who had undergone reconstruction surgeries for leprosy-inflicted handicaps and those affected with leprosy was disbursed.
title: Leprosy awareness rally taken out
